content.text: Dice rolling is a fundamental mechanic in Magic Realm, used for determining results on various tables and resolving game events.

subsections.title: Whenever a character is directed to roll the dice and consult a table, he rolls two dice and uses the high roll to find his result

content.text: He must identify the table he is using before he rolls and he must roll the dice openly and reveal his result. Example: If he rolls "2" and "5" his result is "5", the higher of the two numbers rolled.

subsections.title: Some Special Advantages, Treasure cards, and spells cause a character to roll one die to find his result, and others add to or subtract from each die roll

content.text: All such modifications are cumulative. Results greater than "6" convert to "6", and results less than "1" convert to "1". Example: If a character with two "+1" modifications rolls "2" and "5", his result is "7" (his high roll +l +l), which converts to "6".

subsections.title: When making "game" die rolls such as the Monster Roll, simply roll one die and do not modify the result
Die roll modifications that apply to a character do not apply to the denizens he controls

content.text: When a hired native or controlled monster uses a table, the die roll is affected only by those modifications that apply to that native or monster. Character Special Advantages do not apply to their hirelings.
